qas.question: What name was it assumed Elizabeth would take upon her marriage to Philip?
What Prime Minister objected to the name change?
What name did Elizabeth keep as her married name?
What name was adopted for Elizabeth's male-line descendants who do not have royal titles?
When did Elizabeth decree the use of Mountbatten-Windsor as the  surname?
In what year did Winston Churchill die?
How many male-line descendants do Elizabeth and Philip have with no royal title?
What was the Duke's first name?
What was the name of Elizabeth and Philip's last child?

context: With Elizabeth's accession, it seemed probable that the royal house would bear her husband's name, becoming the House of <a0_0>Mountbatten,<a0_0/> in line with the custom of a wife taking her husband's surname on marriage. The British Prime Minister, <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>Winston<b8_0/><b7_0/> Churchill<a1_0/>, and Elizabeth's grandmother, Queen Mary, favoured the retention of the <a2_0>House of Windsor<a2_0/>, and so on <b6_0>9<b6_0/> April 1952 Elizabeth issued a declaration that Windsor would continue to be the name of the royal house. The Duke complained, "I am the only man in the country not allowed to give his name to his own children." In <a4_0>1960<a4_0/>, after the death of Queen Mary in 1953 and the resignation of Churchill in <b5_0>1955<b5_0/>, the surname <a3_0>Mountbatten-Windsor<a3_0/> was adopted for Philip and Elizabeth's male-line descendants who do not carry royal titles.
